description:
In _poll_rescued_instances(),

compute_api.unrescue_instance() -> self.update() -> self._update() -> db.instance_update...() -> BOOM
title: _poll_rescued_instances() makes an invalid database query

comments.content:
In _poll_rescued_instances(),

compute_api.unrescue_instance() -> self.update() -> self._update() -> db.instance_update...() -> BOOM
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danms

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/26883
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/26883
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/188f306aa88a6a5b73959c74f1642720d7627789
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 188f306aa88a6a5b73959c74f1642720d7627789
Author: Dan Smith <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Apr 12 11:25:18 2013 -0700

    Make compute/manager use conductor for unrescue()
    
    The compute_api.unrescue() call makes direct database queries, which means
    it can't be called directly from compute manager. This patch adds support
    in conductor for proxying this request and makes compute manager utilize
    it.
    
    Fixes bug 1167619
    
    Change-Id: I158c64cabdfe436462f5669047fb930819a13c50
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

    Make compute/manager use conductor for unrescue()
    
    The compute_api.unrescue() call makes direct database queries, which means
    it can't be called directly from compute manager. This patch adds support
    in conductor for proxying this request and makes compute manager utilize
    it.
    
    Fixes bug 1167619
